video.title: The Tibetan Book of the Dead - Padmasambhava - Instructions for Dying and in the Bardo
video.description:
This is a condensed version of The Tibetan Book of the Dead by Padmasambhava. It was written down by Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche’s great grand-father, according to vision-teachings he directly received from Padmasambhava. Tulku Urgyen said that meditators would all benefit immensely from being familiar with these reminders.
Translated by Eric Pema Kunsang. You can find the text and background story here on Eric's website:
http://levekunst.com/how-to-die-a-teaching-from-the-lotus-born/

The Bardo Thodol ( "Liberation Through Hearing During the Intermediate State"), commonly known in the West as The Tibetan Book of the Dead, is a text from a larger corpus of teachings, the Profound Dharma of Self-Liberation through the Intention of the Peaceful and Wrathful Ones, revealed by Karma Lingpa (1326–1386). It is the best-known work of Nyingma .
